definitions: Creates or shapes (a metal object) by heating it in a fire or furnace and beating or hammering it.
Produces a copy or imitation of (a document, signature, or banknote) for the purpose of deception.
Creates (a relationship, alliance, or new direction) with effort.
examples: The blacksmith forges the iron into a new tool.
She forges documents to avoid paying taxes.
The ship forges ahead through the waves.
